tool.name: Interseqcorr
tool.description: : Calculate correlation between all base pairs of a single sequence and for a single helical parameter.

param.name: input_ser_path
param.label: input SER file
param.help: Path to .ser file with data for single helical parameter. Format: [input].ser

param.name: outname_output_csv_path
param.label: output CSV name
param.help: Path to directory where output is saved Format: [output].csv

param.name: outname_output_jpg_path
param.label: output JPG name
param.help: Path to .jpg file where output is saved Format: [output].jpg

param.name: sele
param.label: Take tool settings:
param.help: Select where tool settings are to be read from

param.name: properties
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: File containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: jsonstr
param.label: JSON string
param.help: JSON string containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: sequence
param.label: sequence
param.help: Nucleic acid sequence for the input .ser file. Length of sequence is expected to be the same as the total number of columns in the .ser file, minus the index column (even if later on a subset of columns is selected with the *seqpos* option).

param.name: helpar_name
param.label: helpar_name
param.help: helical parameter name to add to plot title.

param.name: seqpos
param.label: seqpos
param.help: list of sequence positions (columns indices starting by 0) to analyze. If not specified it will analyse the complete sequence. (Json)
